author: Special Correspondent
text:
Four girls, all studying in the ninth standard of a private school here, who went missing on Thursday were tracked down in Kumbakonam on Friday night.

Police sources said the girls all aged 14 and close friends and had failed last year in class 9 had left school on Thursday morning itself and when their parents found that out, they lodged a complaint with the Velipalayam police station who launched a manhunt for locating the girls. The police tracked down the mobile phone signals of the girls to Kumbakonam and alerted their counterparts in the temple town who immediately located and secured the girls. Investigation revealed that the quartet had gone to Velankanni and then to Tiruvarur before arriving in Kumbakonam.

After counselling, the girls were handed over to their anxious parents.
title: Four missing girls traced
